homura.vision.data.folder module¶

Bases: torch.utils.data.dataset.Dataset

Abstract class for ImageFolder and LabelCorruptedImages

static image_loader(path)[source]¶
class homura.vision.data.folder.ImageFolder(root, transform=None, num_samples: int = None, on_memory: bool = False)[source]¶

Bases: homura.vision.data.folder.FolderABC

A generic data loader where the images are arranged in this way

root/cat/xxx.png
root/dog/xxx.png
Parameters

  • root –

  • transform –

  • num_samples – Number of samples you want to use. If None, use all samples.

  • on_memory – True if you want to store loaded images on the RAM for faster reloading. (False by default)

IMG_EXTENSIONS = ['.jpg', '.jpeg', '.png', '.ppm', '.bmp', '.pgm', '.tif']¶

homura.vision.data.loaders.cifar100_loaders(batch_size: int, num_workers: int = 4, root: str = '~/.torch/data/cifar100', data_augmentation: Optional[Iterable] = None, val_size: int = 0, replacement: bool = False, num_train_samples: Optional[int] = None, force_download: bool = False)[source]¶

A simple data loader for CIFAR-100

Parameters

  • batch_size –

  • num_workers –

  • root –

  • data_augmentation – default transformation is RandomCrop(32, padding=4) and RandomHorizontalFlip()

  • val_size –

  • replacement – sampling with replacement

  • num_train_samples – number of data sampled when replacement is True

  • force_download –

Returns

(train_loader, test_loader) if val_size==0 else (train_loader, test_loader, val_loader)

estimates per channel image dataset statistics (mean, stdev)

>>> estimator.from_directory("data/images")
>>> estimator.from_batch(img_tensor)
>>> estimator.estimated
